name: De Vere Cameron House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a 2 nights activities stay package at Cameron House last February. Really warm welcome and valet parking, the hotel is gorgeous and to a really high standard. Room was stunning, really dark décor, massive bed, could tell everything was a really high quality.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel and booked dinner in the Boat House. As part of the activities package there was whiskey tasting in the whiskey bar. Very informative and got us tipsy before dinner. Boat House is a short wander from the hotel so staff drove us down and picked us back up. Boat house is quite relaxed,we got ribs and pizzas. great meal and great service then headed back to the hotel and had a few drinks in Great Scots Bar. We were picked up at the hotel to go quad biking as our activity which was loads of fun. On our first morning we got breakfast in bed but the second we went down for breakfast and the selection was huge. Both myself and my partner absolutely loved it, best hotel we've ever stayed in, service is amazing and nothing is a hassle. Next time we're going to make sure we visit the spa and bring our swimming costumes. Perfect hotel, couldn't fault anything with it and will definitely visit again.
reviews.title: Amazing location, great staff and room....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As expected great hotel, well designed and staffed with employees who care and are clearly well trained. Food was excellent and facilities great, concierge gents very knowledgeable and helpful. Great scottish feel. Room was fantastic and very large finished to high spec. Would highly recommend
reviews.title: MIXED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As nearly everyone says, the setting is fantastic. The overall experience was very mixed, and my main criticism is poor communication between staff.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Stay at an Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked to see a room before deciding to stay, and being satisfied, were soon shown to a room as far away from reception as you could imagine, with only a shower! After protesting we wanted a bath, we were reallocated to a nearby room. 2 newspapers were ordered, but only 1 delivered, though that was redressed at reception FOC.
reviews.title: Sheer quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all I must point out that I have stayed here a few times, and on the first occassion I was a little disappointed with the standard of service in the bar and breakfast restaurant, and could relate to some of the reviews on here. I did tell the manager of my disappoinment, and in fairness she was very upset about it and addressed the issues. I have since returned and there has been a marked improvement in this area, and I will have no hesitation in returning time and again as the setting and atmosphere really are breathtaking. We stayed in a Loch View room the last time and I only wish we had stayed for longer as I could never tire of that view first thing in a morning.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, amazing building, with service an atmosphere to match

reviews.text: I have eaten at all of the restaurants throughout the hotel and have never been disappointed, and as someone who eats out quite regularly and travels alot, for one hotel to have three fantastic - but very different - restaurants is pretty rare. I particularly like the relaxed atmosphere in the boathouse.
reviews.title: Great physical facility but undermined by uneven service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are stunning, as is the rest of the hotel and grounds, but that alone isn't enough to drag me back to a place. All of the staff make the atmosphere friendly and relaxed, and personally I value that more than any comfort, view or setting - if that isn't there then the rest is irrelevant.
reviews.title: Cameron House - another fantastic return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say anymore than I would recommend it to my friends and family, and will be returning myself in the very near future.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful ambiance, shame about the food

reviews.text: Oh, and the breakfast is out of this world!
reviews.title: Huge swings in quality
Amazing overnight stay in March
reviews.text: We stayed in March for one night on the "only on a Sunday" offer which included breafast and dinner in the Boathouse restaurant.
From the moment we arrived the service was fantastic. We drove straight up to the front door and took advantage of the valet parking service. The reception area is stunning.
reviews.title: Beautiful lodging on the banks of Loch Lomond!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable and the decor was lovely. We had a bottle of bubbly waiting for us in the room, which was part of the deal.
reviews.title: Superb!!!

reviews.text: The Boathouse restaurant was excellent. Before we arrived I was unsure what to expect as it is a short walk from the main hotel but I needn't have had any concerns. I ony wish it had been dayight when we went to enjoy the views outside.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We took breafast in our room which in hindsight I feel was a mistake as I would have liked to have seen the main restuarant.
reviews.title: Another good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from a 2 night stay here, and it's quite good but far from perfect. To be fair we got a very good B&B rate so in general I can't complain but I do have some observations:
reviews.title: More 4 star than 5 star

aka: De Vere Cameron House Hotel West Dunbartonshire
description: A magnificent baronial mansion surrounded by 100 acres of woodland, Cameron House on Loch Lomond, blends traditional Scottish influences with sumptuous contemporary decor to offer guests a memorable stay in the finest surroundings. This is your loch side Baronial mansion and so much more, with a Championship golf course, a luxury resort spa with rooftop infinity pool, a range of luxury traditional and contemporary suites with views overlooking Loch Lomond and some of the most supreme dining imaginable, all bundled up and served with the heartiest of Scottish hospitality. Cameron House on Loch Lomond is every part the five star Scottish experiences and located just 25 minutes from Glasgow International Airport.
